Clinical (Back Office) instruction includes infection control, vital signs, diagnostic tests, assisting with primary/family and specialties (surgery, OB/GYN, and pediatrics).

Medical Assistant 1B: Administrative and Clinical Skills Part Two|AHV NC006 Second of a two-part course that prepares students to work as entry-level Medical Assistants. Eligibility requires successful completion of Medical Assistant IA and IB

The program encompass courses such as Microsoft Word Fundamentals , Typing/Keyboarding , Microsoft Excel Fundamentals, Microsoft PowerPoint Fundamentals , Microsoft Publisher Fundamentals , & Computer Skills. Class taught in Bilingual setting.
0cf788ae-6af5-4ecf-aa60-ca5e8324c0b5.name: Office Computer Applications (Bilingual)

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Barbara City College

badge_template_activities.title: Microsoft Word Fundamentals (Bilingual) | CMPW NC005 This course for beginners provides a basic understating of Microsoft Word tools. Students learn to create professional quality letters, certificates, flyers, labels and more.

Typing/Keyboarding (Bilingual) |CMPW NC001 This class module promotes an understanding of the basic typing and keyboarding skills. It is intended for students who have no previous keyboarding experience or want to improve their keyboarding skills.

Microsoft PowerPoint Fundamentals(Bilingual) | CMPW NC006 This introductory bilingual course provides a basic understanding of Microsoft PowerPoint, a program that allows students to create effective presentations to convey a message through the use of words, graphics, shapes, color, sound and special effects.

Microsoft Excel Fundamentals (Bilingual)| CMPW NC007 This Bilingual course for beginners provides a basic understanding of Microsoft Excel. Students will learn to create functional and professional-looking spreadsheets.

Microsoft Publisher Fundamentals (Bilingual) | CMPW NC008 Bilingual course that teaches students fundamental skills using Microsoft Publisher, a popular desktop publishing program. Topics include editing, formatting and business forms through the use of pre-designed or blank publications.

Computer/Skills Lab (Bilingual) |CMPW NC010 The bilingual lab features individualized, hands-on instruction and small group lectures. Students learn at own pace and design their own practice schedule in several computer software programs including keyboarding, data entry, 10-key, Window operating systems, MS Office (Word, Excel, Publisher, PowerPoint), and Internet/email.

73d25bd9-e5b7-49f6-96b7-b0be4d532bfd.description: The Restorative Nurse Assistant Training Program consists of two courses (RNA Introduction and RNA Advanced). These courses include content related to mobility, performance of activities of daily living, aging effects on the five senses and management of cognitive deficit. The RNA Program prepares students to work as restorative assistants focusing on therapeutic modalities, exercise and rehabilitation management
73d25bd9-e5b7-49f6-96b7-b0be4d532bfd.name: Restorative Nurse Assistant Training, Certificate of Completion

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Barbara City College

badge_template_activities.title: Restorative Nurse Assistant Training - Introduction |AHV NC030 Prepares licensed CNAs to assist patients/residents in maintaining or promoting independence in the areas of mobility, range of motion, and the performance of activities of daily living. This course is the first in a two-part series leading to a SBCC Noncredit Educational Programs Certificate of Completion for Restorative Nurse Assistants.  Must have current active CNA license, TB clearance and healthcare provider CPR.

Restorative Nurse Assistant Training - Advanced |AHV NC031 Advanced course for licensed CNAs reviewing the aging process on the five senses, restorative techniques for the therapeutic use of heat and cold, positioning and exercise, and management for cognitive deficit. Course restricted to 98 repetitions. Prerequisites: AH NC030

3ce2dfd9-b0ca-4aab-9254-c669963a8892.description: Earners of this certificate have developed and delivered a series of sales scripts to fit a given sales situation and effectively deliver scripts. They have demonstrated techniques for closing sales as well delivered scripts for call centers and inside sales.
3ce2dfd9-b0ca-4aab-9254-c669963a8892.name: Sales Techniques Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Barbara City College

badge_template_activities.title: Closing Techniques that Win the Sale | PROW NC056 Learn closing techniques to address customers' emotional needs, get past the obstacles preventing them from buying, and build long-term customer relationships.

Winning Sales Scripts | PROW NC057  Identify the key roles in the sales process and develop a script based sales strategy. Write and deliver face-to-face, voicemail and email messages to open and close sales transactions.

468b0724-c711-420f-a91c-5532aa52b6e9.description: The Successful Work and Life Transitions enables students to develop the skills, attitudes and practical steps to effectively navigating work and life transitions. Those who earn this certificate increase their self-awareness and learn not only what it takes to secure a new job, but also how to prepare for a better job. It is also a gateway into other noncredit and credit programs, helping students develop workplace skills and training that will qualify them for even greater work opportunities.
468b0724-c711-420f-a91c-5532aa52b6e9.name: Successful Work and Life Transitions Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Barbara City College

badge_template_activities.title: Creating A Life of Purpose for Workplace Success | PROW NC080 Focuses on the integral role that purpose plays in our lives-both professionally & personally- how to discover, optimize, and align life purpose with employment for optimal health, happiness & success in the emerging "Purpose Economy." Combining concepts from brain science, several seminal books on purpose, leadership & the Japanese Ikigai model- we examine, define, & tie our life purpose to our day-to-day operations and interactions.

Transitions Nuts and Bolts 1 PROW NC081 Reconnected community living & working is the result of a multitude of factors that all work in tandem. Explore, identify, analyze & develop critical thinking regarding the factors involved in personally engaged community living. Knowledge into the creation of an individualized transitions strategy, or "plan," is applied. Learn to develop your social EI & reconnect to yourself & your communities in ways that are personally & professionally meaningful.

Creating Successful Life and Work Tranisiton Plans | PROW NC082 Explore, identify, analyze, & develop critical thinking skills to learn to adapt to a new environment while bringing your experience & strengths with you. Also includes strategizing and developing a Life, Housing & Employment Blueprint. Develop complex problem-solving skills for managing your personal and professional relationships and challenges in order to thrive during transitions & prepare to enter or re-enter the workforce.

79ae3a12-cd8c-44d8-8530-b94ac2df874a.description: Tax Preparation Certificate provides beginning tax preparation skills and techniques in a one-semester course in the academic and practical material dealing with tax preparation to prepare students for current workforce.
79ae3a12-cd8c-44d8-8530-b94ac2df874a.name: Tax Preparation

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Barbara City College

badge_template_activities.title: Exploring IRS Enrolled Agent Work | ACTV NC214 The student explores the work of an IRS enrolled agent and studies the requirements for the profession, including the Special Enrollment Examination, how to maintain enrolled agent status, and Circular 230 regulatory requirements.

Fundamentals of Income Tax | ACTV NC215 Covers practical information on Federal and California income tax law as it relates to individuals and small businesses (proprietorships, partnerships, corporation and fiduciary entities).

51505542-1421-409b-8d44-3f0db1ee7f57.description: COMING SOON: The Visionary Leader Certificate enables students to develop the strategic communication techniques and skills to optimize organizational culture and develop current employees into successful future leaders. This certificate is also a gateway into other noncredit and credit programs, helping students develop workplace skills and training that will qualify them for even more work opportunities.Draft to come
51505542-1421-409b-8d44-3f0db1ee7f57.name: Visionary Leadership

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Barbara City College

badge_template_activities.title: The  Art and Science of Giving and Receiving Feedback |PROW NC088  Feedback is critical to improving individual performance and organizational effectiveness. Sharing information on what can and needs to be improved helps optimize work processes and gets things done more efficiently. This class clearly outlines why the most successful organizations only exist in an atmosphere of open feedback and provides techniques and practical applications of best practices in giving and receiving feedback.

Thriving in a Multigenerational Workforce |PROW NC086. With up to five different generations in the U.S. workforce, we must better understand how this impacts workplace dynamics and effectiveness. This course explores the differences among the generations and develops the tools needed to capitalize on the strengths that each generation brings to better collaborate across generations for greater gains.

Planning for Your Future Success| PROW NC087 (coming soon) With the ever increasing Baby Boomers' departures from the current workforce, organizations need strategies to not only deal with the loss of institutional knowledge, but to identify and groom current workers for key vacated leadership positions. This class addresses both needs, and helps map out and prepare the current workforce and organization for future needs.

c0c2f260-8012-436e-8d8c-446cf2246b28.description: The certificate in Visual Basic for Applications (VBA) Fundamentals is designed to provide students with introductory skills in automating Microsoft Office applications. Successful completion of this certificate prepares students with career-related work skills in organizations desiring to automate the Microsoft Office Suite. This certificate is a gateway into credit programs, helping students prepare for a more complete set of courses and programs in Microsoft Office automation and programming.
c0c2f260-8012-436e-8d8c-446cf2246b28.name: Visual Basic for Applications Fundamentals

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Barbara City College

badge_template_activities.title: Visual Basic for Applications: Excel Course | CISV NC020 introduces students to automating Excel applications using Visual Basic for Applications programming.
Visual Basic for Applications: Access Course | CISV NC021 introduces students to automating Access applications using Visual Basic for Applications programming.

92f56548-ed2d-436d-b61d-94a1d23305ba.description: The certificate of completion in VMware vSphere Install, Configure, Manage provides students with the skills and competencies to install, configure and manage vSphere systems. This certificate is a gateway into credit programs, helping students prepare for a more complete set of courses and programs in the system administration area.
92f56548-ed2d-436d-b61d-94a1d23305ba.name: VMware vSphere Install, Configure, Manage

issuer.summary: issued by Santa Barbara City College

badge_template_activities.title: VMware vSphere Advanced Management | CISV NC006 Managing advanced features of VMware vSphere.
VMware vSphere Install and Configure | CISV NC005 Introduction to VMware vSphere, with an emphasis on the installation and configuration of the product.
